KXPkuxCuAVXr2RSWb6zXkrD1cspYYZ"]}},"version":1}

getCollateralInfo(address,address).details: returns a the relevant info for a collateral

getCollateralRatio(address,address,addre.details: returns the collateral ratio of a vault

getHealthFactor(address,address,address).details: returns health factor (if a vault is liquidatable or not) of a vault

getMaxBorrowable(address,address,address.details: returns the max amount of currency a vault owner can mint for that vault without the tx reverting due to the vault's health factor falling below the min health factorif it's a negative number then the vault is below the min health factor already and paying back the additive inverse of the result will pay back both borrowed amount and interest accrued

getMaxWithdrawable(address,address,addre.details: returns the max amount of collateral a vault owner can withdraw from a vault without the tx reverting due to the vault's health factor falling below the min health factorif it's a negative number then the vault is below the min health factor already and depositing the additive inverse will put the position at the min health factor saving it from liquidation.the recommended way to do this is to burn/pay back the additive inverse of the result of `getMaxBorrowable()` that way interest would not accrue after payment.

getVault(address,address,address).details: returns a vault's relevant info i.e the depositedCollateral, borrowedAmount, and updated accruedFeesrecommended to read the accrued fees from here as it'll be updated before being returned.

documentation.text:
@dev returns the max amount of currency a vault owner can mint for that vault without the tx reverting due to the vault's health factor falling below the min health factor
 @dev if it's a negative number then the vault is below the min health factor already and paying back the additive inverse of the result will pay back both borrowed amount and interest accrued

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract Vault,contract ERC20,address) view returns (struct IVault.VaultInfo memory)

documentation.text:
@dev returns a vault's relevant info i.e the depositedCollateral, borrowedAmount, and updated accruedFees
 @dev recommended to read the accrued fees from here as it'll be updated before being returned.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract Vault,contract ERC20) view returns (struct IVault.CollateralInfo memory)

documentation.text: @dev returns a the relevant info for a collateral

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct IVault.CollateralInfo memory,struct IVault.VaultInfo memory) pure returns (uint256)

documentation.text:
@dev returns the collateral ratio of a vault where anything below 1e18 is liquidatable
 @dev should never revert!

@dev returns the conversion of a vaults deposited collateral to the vault's currency
 @dev should never revert!

@dev returns the conversion of an amount of currency to a given supported collateral
 @dev should never revert!

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract Vault,struct IVault.CollateralInfo memory) view returns (uint256)

documentation.text:
@dev returns the fees accrued by a user's vault since `_vault.lastUpdateTime`
 @dev should never revert!

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract Vault) view returns (struct IVault.RateInfo memory)

documentation.text:
@dev returns the current total accumulated rate i.e current accumulated base rate + current accumulated collateral rate of the given collateral
 @dev should never revert!

@dev scales a given collateral to be represented in 1e18
 @dev should never revert!
